title: Adams National Historical Park: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park        Click on the links below to learn about the rich history and opportunities available at Adams National Historical Park!           Ranger Betty as Abigail Adams talks to local school children about life in the 1700's    Education  There are several ways for your students to "step into history."  Click the image to learn about the different curriculum based education programs we offer at Adams National Historical Park!          John Quincy Adams, Oil by by John Singleton Copley, 1796   People  Did you know that four generations of the Adams family lived in the Old House at Peace field? This includes two first ladies, three ambassadors to Great Britain, and a Pulitzer Prize winner! Click on the image to learn about some of the fascinating people who called Quincy, Massachusetts home.              Old House at Peace field around 1852   Photo Gallery Three homes and acres of gardens provide for beautiful photographs.  Click the image to see photos of the homes through the ages, or some of the events that have been held at Adams National Historical Park.             Too Late to Apologize: A Declaration SOOMO Publishing   Too Late to Apologize: A Declaration  Some times you need a rockin' good interpretation of the Continental Congress.  Check out SOOMO Publishing's video about July 4, 1776.
